newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel tax 10-mth revenue at 78.6 bln shekels.
newsitem.headline: Israel tax 10-mth revenue at 78.6 bln shekels.

text.p: The Israeli government's tax revenues totalled 78.6 billion shekels in the first 10 months of the year, a real increase of three percent from the same period last year, the Treasury said.
Income tax revenue totalled 42.8 billion shekels, a real decrease of 1.0 percent, while revenue from valued added and customs tax rose five percent to 35.1 billion shekels.
Continuing at the current pace, the government will be about five billion shekels short of its original revenue forecast of 99.2 billion shekels for all of 1996.
